pr_title: Added Chance Drop for MOB_DROP recipe items. References #980

timeline.message:
Added Chance Drop for MOB_DROP recipe items. References #980

Added interface for ChanceDrop items

Added a check for chance drop items in the EntityDeathListener

Adjusted circuit board to have a 75% chance rather than 100% chance

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+package me.mrCookieSlime.Slimefun.Objects.SlimefunItem.interfaces;
+
+import io.github.thebusybiscuit.slimefun4.core.attributes.ItemAttribute;
+
+/**
+ * This interface, when attached to a {@link SlimefunItem}, provides an easy method for adding 
+ * a % chance to drop for an {@link SlimefunItem} on {@link entityDeathEvent}, this chance is 0-100
+ * and used in conjunction with the MOB_DROP {@link RecipeType}. 
+ * see {@link BasicCircuitBoard} and {@link MobDropListener}.

timeline.bodyText: Also, since this is in a for loop... wouldn't this add the entire drops list multiple times instead of the items one by one?
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: I see what you're saying here, however; in testing I did not ever receive any extra drops no matter how many other items the creature in question dropped.   It may have become an issue if the creature dropped multiple slimefun items...   Moved the logic to the addDrops() method to just skip them if they fail the chance check.
replies.author: dniym

replies.bodyText: Yes, you are looping through "customDrops", so this issue would only appear when multiple Slimefun items were at play here.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: No need to even have this CircuitBoard variable at this point anymore. You can just check if sfi is an instance of your Circuit Board, would be much better performance wise since you already done these operations earlier.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
No "and" here. The syntax is as follow:
@ see x
@ see y
And we usually place it below the @ author tag.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit
